===Etymology===
This position (the feudal equivalent of a [[w:United States Secret Service|Secret service]] agent, i.e. responsible for palace security) was established in the {{w|Qin Dynasty}}. Later, in the {{w|Han Dynasty}}, {{lang|zh|中郎}} were assigned to one of five different squads ({{zh-l|官*}}). Each one of these squads had its own leader, which was called {{zh-l|中郎將*}} (commander of the palace guards).
